newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo stocks end down, NCB fails to ignite market.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo stocks end down, NCB fails to ignite market.

text.p: Tokyo stocks ended with losses on Thursday as buying of bank shares on news of a business tie-up between Nippon Credit Bank Ltd (NCB) and Bankers Trust New York Corp waned in the afternoon session, brokers said.
The 225-share Nikkei average lost 217.62 points or 1.23 percent to 17,485.75. Its June futures were 220 points down at 17,490.
"There were hopes in the morning the NCB news would boost bank shares but support was short-lived," said Harushige Kobayashi, Yamaichi Securities Co Ltd deputy general manager.
